alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 12:26PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in southern New Jersey...Burlington and Camden. In southeast Pennsylvania... Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1226 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Yeadon, Riverside, Palmyra, Beverly, Wissinoming, Tacony, Golden Triangle, Holmesburg, and Cherry Hill Mall. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 4. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 18 and 33. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 343 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey near mile marker 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 37 and 41. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 4. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
